intro: Nolana onoana, commonly known as the Hawaiian nolana, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in coastal and dry forest habitats, often growing on rocky soils. Nolana onoana is an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of the region.
